499. Toppings Jane (Mrs. William H.)
PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to express a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experience; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don’t worry about leaving blank spaces. Use every space at your disposal, even if there is not sufficient space to answer the question. Don’t hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

The questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in eastern Canada before 1875, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questions:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled “Pioneer Past and Present Canadian Pioneers East” is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement etc.).

I can't recall any specific incidents from the trip.

The first incident I can remember was when we encountered a group of Indians near the town where we stopped for the night. They seemed friendly and curious about us, and we exchanged some words in broken English.

We continued our journey through the mountains and eventually arrived at our destination.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

At my mother's house.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

I took up land near Broadview.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement etc.).

Can't recall any exciting incidents on the trip.

The first Indians I saw was that summer. A tribe of Indians came to the house when I was alone and asked for food. This wasn't so long after the Rebellion that some were rather quarrelsome and resentful towards white people so of course I was nervous.

These Indians were travelling from Broadview to the Moose Mountains and were required to carry permits for travelling from one reservation to another.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

At my sisters

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

I kept house for my brother north of Broadview.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

I wrote when someone was going to the nearest town (Whitecourt or Broadview) where letters could be mailed.

25 + 23 miles away

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

My husband Wm H. Toppings was councillor for years the first years of local improvements. The farmers were hard work with forced earning money to apply on their taxes. In that way we had our first roads.
